page.title: 12The Railway
page.content: The railway has been one of the things that greatly affected life in this corner of Essex and changed it from an area of quiet, peaceful villages, surrounded by farmlands and woods to the busy commercial area that it is today.(Although the farmland and the woods have not,thankfully, disappeared altogether.) The railway was built in 1889 and on 3rd October 1889, at 7.13 a.m.the first passenger train for Rochford, Hockley and London left Southend Station. Rochfordians set out early on their penny farthings headed by the local chemist, Mr. Harrington, who bought the first ticket, No. 0001. Since those early days the line has been electrified.At Rochford only the Victorian goods-shed that used to house sheep's wool, grain etc.,remains which has been restored and is now a community centre -"The Freight House."
